title: Entry Point: Enter the trade when the price

steps.title: Entry Point: Enter the trade when the price
steps.trigger: the price breaks out of a key resistance level or shows a clear upward/downward trend
steps.condition: the price breaks out of a key resistance level or shows a clear upward/downward trend
steps.notes: Original: Entry Point: Enter the trade when the price breaks out of a key resistance level or shows a clear upward/downward trend

steps.title: Exit Point: Exit the trade when the momentum
steps.trigger: the momentum starts to fade, indicated by reduced volume or reversal patterns
steps.notes: Original: Exit Point: Exit the trade when the momentum starts to fade, indicated by reduced volume or reversal patterns

steps.title: Risk Management: Use stop-loss orders to limit ...
steps.trigger: Risk Management: Use stop-loss orders to limit potential losses and take-profit levels to secure gains
steps.notes: Original: Risk Management: Use stop-loss orders to limit potential losses and take-profit levels to secure gains

sources.author: api_user
sources.snippet: How It Works Identify Momentum: Look for assets with strong price movements, often triggered by news, earnings reports, or market sentiment. High trading volume typically accompanies these movements.
